Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to prove that the "try to be less white" slides were included in Coca-Cola's mandatory diversity training for employees.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the presence of the Coca-Cola logo in the screenshots proves that the training was required for Coca-Cola employees, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the screenshots and their connection to Coca-Cola's training, which have not been fully explored or confirmed.
Contradict fact: While the screenshots and the course featuring Robin DiAngelo are authentic, Coca-Cola has explicitly denied that the "try to be less white" slides were part of their mandatory diversity training, contradicting the claim.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the slides and their inclusion in Coca-Cola's training, as it is not yet confirmed whether they were actually part of the curriculum.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any biases.
